c74object.name: max-ble
c74object.description: Max Object to interface with Bluetooth Low Energy devices like Mobile devices, Arduinos and other micro-controllers

inlet.digest: Message inlet: valid messages begin with scan, stop, found, clear, connect, report and device
inlet.description: Message inlet: valid messages begin with scan, stop, found, clear, connect, report and device

outlet.digest: List Outlet: The found message will output a list of found device UUIDs and RSSIs in series. A connect message will output Service and Charachteristic UUIDs with raw bytes in series.
outlet.description: List ID: The found message will output a list of found device UUIDs and RSSIs in series. A connect message will output Service and Charachteristic UUIDs with raw bytes in series.

outlet.digest: Notification outlet: Subscribed charateristics will output a list of Characteristic UUID and raw bytes on value change
outlet.description: Notification outlet: Subscribed charateristics will output a list of Characteristic UUID and raw bytes on value change

method.name: clear
method.digest: clear the internal list of found devices.
method.description: clear the internal list of found devices.

method.name: connect
method.digest: connect followed by an int will attempt connect to a found device at the given index. Connect to a device first before attempting to read, write, subscribe or unsubscribe from a device.
method.description:
connect int: connect followed by an int will attempt connect to a found device at the given index. All Services and Characteristics will be sent out the first outlet and will bre printed if reporting is on.
connect symbol: connect followed by a symbol will interpret the symbol as uuid and attept to connect to the specified device. If the device has not yet been discovered this will trigger scanning and immediately connect once the device has been found.
connect name symbol: connect followed by name then a symbol will interpret the symbol as device name. This will connect to the first device in found devices matching the name.

method.name: filter
method.description:
filter rssi int:
ignore devices with an RSSI higher than the int specified
filter iphone int:
toggle ignoring apple devices with 1 to ignore and 0 to allow. Useful for thinning out scanning for Arduinos.
filter services UUIDlist:
'filter' followed by 'services' followed by a list of symbols will scan only for devices advertising one of the listed service UUIDs. This message will trigger the scanning process if it is not already active.

method.name: found
method.digest: output, in series, the list of found devices and their RSSIs from outlet 3 and post this to the Max Console if reporting is on.
method.description: output, in series, the list of found devices and their RSSIs from outlet 3 and post this to the Max Console if reporting is on.

method.name: read
method.digest: A read message will output the latest values of the speicifed characteristic from the left outlet
method.description: A read message is in the form: "read DEVICE SERVICE CHARACTERISTIC". Device can be either index or UUID. Service and characteristic are both UUID, 16-bit or 128-bit. A read DEVICE message will just grab all values.

method.name: report
method.digest: A report message followed by 0 or 1 will toggle reporting printouts to the Max Console.
method.description: A report message followed by 0 or 1 will toggle reporting printouts to the Max Console.

method.name: scan
method.digest: A scan message will begin scanning for BLE devices. A scan message followed by 0 or 1 will toggle scanning.
method.description:
scan int:
scan followed by 0 or 1 will toggle scanning.
scan symbol:
scan followed by a list of symbols will begin scanning for devices with any of the advertised uuids in the list

method.name: stop
method.digest: A stop message will halt scanning.
method.description: A stop message will halt scanning.

method.name: subscribe
method.digest: Subscribe to a notifying characteristic. See also unsubscribe
method.description: A "subscribe device service characteristic" message will attempt to subscribe to the notifying characteristic of "device" (index or uuid). Service and characteristic can be 16-bit or 128-bit UUIDs

method.name: write
method.digest: A write message will write byte data to a characteristic of a device.
method.description: A "write device service characteristic bytes" message will write the list of bytes to the 'device' (index or uuid) to the "characteristic" of "service" (16-bit or 128-bit UUID). The list of bytes can be formatted as a symbol, a list of floats or a list of longs

method.name: unsubscribe
method.digest: Unsubscribe to a notifying characteristic. See also: subscribe
method.description: A "unsubscribe device service characteristic" message will attempt to unsubscribe to the notifying characteristic of "device" (index or uuid). Service and characteristic can be 16-bit or 128-bit UUIDs
